Name: Isis breast-feeding Horus
Description: This small piece in enameled steatite is a remarkable representation of the very well known theme of the goddess Isis breast-feeding her son Horus. The decoratives lines engraved on the lower part indicate that the object was a seal. The stylistic characteristics, which have a lot in common with those of the statues of the Old Kingdom,  furthermore suggest that it belongs to the "archaistic" works of the 26th Dynasty.
